dlgAnsw.text: “I've just returned from Ganezzar. Meru's holding his own for now but I don't think he'll last long.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “It serves him right,” says Antidas, not looking very concerned. “Meru turned his back on me years ago and hid in that castle of his. I always knew that he’ll pay for it one day.”

dlgAnsw.text: “You can help him. You have enough men to break the siege and reinforce the garrison.”
“He will pay for it, my Lord, but Castle Ganezzar is well defended. House Aurelian doesn’t have enough men to take it yet. They’ll have to make a deal with the Imperial Guards unless...”

dlgPart.npc_text: “You can’t be serious,” says Antidas, surprised. “Didn’t I just say that Meru had it coming? He betrayed me when I needed him the most and now you expect me to come to his aid? No!”

dlgAnsw.text: “How long will Teron last after Ganezzar falls?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“I’m not scared easily,” Antidas says dismissively. “If they want a fight, they will get one, but that’s a big if.
“Maybe Teron *is* next, in which case I’d rather meet the Aurelian legions with all my strength, not a half of it. Maybe the problem is Meru and if I side with him, leaving Teron weak and ill-defended, they will have no choice but to strike at me as well.”

dlgAnsw.text: “House Aurelian is too strong. Uniting with Meru is your only chance to keep them from swallowing up your domains. Once Ganezzar is taken, this chance will be gone for good.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “I thought so too once and it cost me almost everything. I'm not going to make the same mistake twice.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Then make an alliance with House Aurelian and help them take Ganezzar.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Unless what?” asks Antidas, not paying attention to where this is going.

dlgAnsw.text: “Unless you make an alliance with House Aurelian and help them take Ganezzar.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “An alliance? With House Aurelian? Have you gone mad, <charname>?”

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion]“Think of the consequences if House Aurelian makes a deal with the Guards. Even if they won’t attack Teron next, we’ll be isolated and eventually you’ll have to make amends but by then you’ll have nothing to offer.”
[persuasion][streetwise]“Serenas isn’t Gaelius. He’s younger, less experienced, and easily influenced. Aid him now and he won’t forget it. Do nothing and he’ll fall under Dux Paullus’ influence.”

[streetwise]“Meru made a deal with Gaelius and betrayed you years ago. Now it’s your chance to repay him with the same coin. Don’t you want Meru to know that it was you who brought him down? Not House Aurelian or the Imperial Guards but you?”

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]“You want me to crawl to Maadoran? Taking everything from me wasn’t enough so now I have to offer them my dignity?”

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion][etiquette]“There is nothing dishonorable about coming to aid of another Lord.”
[streetwise][trading]“What would you rather lose, my Lord? Your dignity or your House that your ancestors built?”

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]“You’d have me bow to a boy? Me, Lord of the noblest of Houses? What would my ancestors say?”

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise][etiquette]“Your ancestors aren’t here, my Lord, but I'm quite certain that had they been here, they would have made the same choice.”
[persuasion]“They would thank you for doing whatever it takes to save the House they built.”

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]“Hmm... It certainly is tempting. There would be a certain poetic justice to it. Still, bowing to House Aurelian is too high a price to bring Meru down.”

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion][streetwise]“You won’t be just repaying Meru for his treachery. In one brilliant strike, you’d thwart the Imperial Guards’ plans to isolate you, secure your House’s future, and prove once and for all that you aren’t man to be underestimated.”

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]“If I do it,” Antidas says slowly, considering the possibility for the first time, “what should I ask for in return? After all, I’ll be doing him quite a favor.”

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion][trading]“I’d suggest trading your military assistance in this and future conflicts for playing a bigger role in governing the new kingdom, consisting of the three cities. You’d have to swear an oath, of course, but it’s hardly more than a formality to get a seat at the table.”

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]“An oath? To that upstart? Out of the question!”

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise][etiquette]“True nobility is exempt from fear, my Lord, including fear of doing something we perceive as less than noble. Only a true scion of the Empire would be able to swear that oath thus proving the nobility of his lineage and spirit.”

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]“I’ve made my decision, Praetor. Be gone.”

dlgAnsw.text: It appears you're out of options. Might as well return to Meru and hear him out.

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]“Very well,” says Antidas, sounding regal once again. “I command you to take my army and assist the brotherly House Aurelian in taking Ganezzar. I also bestow upon you a duty to negotiate a proper and honorable agreement with House Aurelian.”

dlgAnsw.text: Travel to Ganezzar with Antidas' army.
